titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Collection in the Library of Congress
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Ryan Moore

publicationstmt.publisher: Geography and Map Division, Library of Congress

controlnote.p: Encoded in EAD3 : Encoded Archival Description (EAD), Version 3 : Release: 1.1.1 : Release Date: 2019-12-16. Validating against latest version of schema.

citation.linktitle: DACS in HTML on SAA website

descriptivenote.p: DACS was used as the primary description standard.

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: Finding aid encoded by the Library of Congress Geography and Map Division

did.head: Collection Summary

corpname.part: Geography and Map Division, Library of Congress

did.abstract: This sub-collection of the Heezen-Tharp maps and papers collection contains some 370 cartographic items and supporting materials that are related to Bruce Heezen and Marie Tharp's mapping of the Arctic Ocean floor. The item types include manuscript and published maps, soundings, reports, and other scientific data. The materials are stored offsite at Ft. Meade and must be requested advance of visiting the Geography and Map Reading Room.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The materials were purchased by the Geography and Map Division throughout the 1990s.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The collection was arranged and described by Gary North and Ryan Moore in 2010.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The parent collection is the Heezen-Tharp maps and papers collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Materials from the Heezen-Tharp collection: Arctic Ocean are governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.) and other applicable international copyright laws.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The Heezen-Tharp collection: Arctic Ocean collection is open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Geography and Map Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Heezen-Tharp collection: Arctic Ocean collection, Geography and Map Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Consists of some 370 items related to Heezen and Tharp's mapping of the Arctic Ocean floor.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Important note: Each Group has a corresponding Holdings Number that can be located in Voyager by Library staff members. Item(s) filed within each Group have a corresponding Barcode number that Library staff members can locate in Voyager to retrieve it from Ft. Meade.
Some Groups or titles within Groups are labeled n/a. These items either were anticipated for acquisition in early processing stages or discarded at a later stage.
The Heezen-Tharp collection: World/Miscellaneous is organized in seven series:

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

did.unittitle: 0003 Bathymetric Chart of the Norwegian Sea and Adjacent Areas Norway: Fiskeridirektoratets Havforkningsinstitut, 1963, Scale bar.

scopecontent.p: a. Photograph b. Depth lines for every 100 meters.

did.unittitle: 0004 The Floor of the Arctic Ocean Physiographic Diagram of the Arctic Ocean Floor, San Diego, California: U.S. Navy Electronics Laboratory, August 1966, Scale bars.

scopecontent.p: a. Paper. b. An interpretation based on echograms collected by U.S. Navy nuclear submarines from 1957 to 1962. Approximate vertical exaggeration is 30x horizontal. Viewpoint is 30˚ above projection plane. Earthquake epicenters from 1955 to 1964 are shown in red. Inset drawings of ships and submarines.

did.unittitle: 0005 Arctic Bathymetry Ottawa: The Canadian Hydrographic Service, 1966-1967, Provisional Edition, #897, 1:2,000,000.

scopecontent.p: a. Paper. b. North of 72˚ , 90˚ to 180˚ West. Depths in meters. Polar Stereographic Projection. A Centennial Project of the Canadian Hydrographic Service.

did.unittitle: 0006 Carte Generale Bathymetrique Des Oceans Paris, France: L'Institut Geographique National, 3d Edition, 1 Oct 68, 1:3,000,000.

scopecontent.p: a. Paper. b. Projection Stereographique Polaire. Bathymetry shown in blue to 5000 meters and topography shown in yellow to 2000 meters.

did.unittitle: 0007 [Bathymetric Chart of the Polar Region] Scale not given.

scopecontent.p: a. Film positive. b. Shows earthquake epicenters. "Returned Oct 29, '69."

did.unittitle: 0008 [Artist Rendition of the Arctic Ocean] Washington, DC: © by National Geographic Society, 20 Jul 71, 1:10,011,000.

scopecontent.p: a. Paper. b. Color proof. Perspective painting by Heinrich C. Berann and assisted by Heinz Vielkind.

did.unittitle: 0009 Arctic Ocean Floor Washington, DC: National Geographic Society, 1971, 1:9,757,000.

scopecontent.p: a. Paper. b. Based on bathymetric studies of Bruce Heezen and Marie Tharp of the Lamont- Doherty Geological Observatory and the U.S. Naval Oceanographic Office. Painted by Heinrich C. Berann, assisted by Heinz Vielkind, compiled by Leo J. Boberschmidt. Azimuthal Equidistant Projection centered on the North Pole. Vertical scale exaggerated. Arctic Ocean political map on verso.

did.unittitle: 0010 Global Navigation and Planning Chart - GNC 1 St. Louis, Missouri: Defense Mapping Agency, Aerospace Center, Edition 6, June, 1972, 1:5,000,000.

scopecontent.p: a. Paper. b. Base map. Shows cultural features of shorelines, cities, drainage, and airfields. Elevations in feet.

a. Paper. b. Base map. Bathymetry by Bruce C. Heezen and Marie Tharp, Lamont-Doherty Laboratory, Columbia University. Bathymetry research was supported by the Office of Naval Research. See HT- II - I -10 - 0012.

a. Paper. b. Base map. Bathymetry by Bruce C. Heezen and Marie Tharp, Lamont-Doherty Laboratory, Columbia University. Bathymetry research was supported by the Office of Naval Research. Includes pencil grid and plots of epicenters for the Norwegian and Greenland Seas. See HT - II - I - 10 - 0011.

did.unittitle: 0013 General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans (GEBCO), 5•17 Ottawa, Canada: Canadian Hydrographic Service, 5th Edition, Aug 79, 1:6,000,000.

scopecontent.p: a. Paper. b. Polar Stereographic Projection. All titling information in English and French.

did.unittitle: 0014 Bathymetry of the Arctic Ocean Boulder, Colorado: The Geological Society of America, Map and Chart Series MC-56, 1986, 1:4,704,075.

scopecontent.p: a. Paper. b. Polar Stereographic Projection. Naval Research Laboratory-Acoustics Division. R.K. Perry and H.S. Flemming. Depths in corrected meters and land mass elevations shown by hypsometric tints. Magnetic anomaly contours shown on verso.

did.unittitle: 0015 Bathymetry of the Barents and Kara Seas Boulder, Colorado: The Geological Society of America, 1991, 1:2,313,000.

scopecontent.p: a. Paper. b. Map and Chart of Series MCH 047. Primary tracks and earthquake epicenters shown on verso.

did.unittitle: 0016 Residual Magnetic Anomaly Chart of the Arctic Ocean Region Washington, DC: Naval Research Laboratory and Naval Ocean Research and Development Activity, Sheet 1, Scale not given.

scopecontent.p: a. Paper. b. Eleven geologic period inset maps shown at top of map. The aeromagnetic profiles shown were collected by various U.S. Navy research organizations during the period 1972 to 1978. Earthquake epicenters to June, 1980 and seafloor spreading shown on verso.
